title: Establishes the open season for hunting coyotes as October 1 through May 31
summary: Establishes the open season for hunting coyotes as October 1 through May 31.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2486

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  LITTLE -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         establishing the open season for hunting coyote

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph o of subdivision 2  of  section  11-0905  of  the
    2  environmental conservation law, as amended by chapter 911 of the laws of
    3  1990, is amended to read as follows:
    4    o. Coyote               [Fixed annually         Fixed annually
    5                            by regulation]          by regulation
    6                            FROM OCTOBER 1
    7                            THROUGH MAY 31
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07961-01-1
memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2486

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to establishing
the open season for hunting coyote

PURPOSE:
Establishes the open season for hunting coyotes as October 1 through
May 31.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 amends paragraph 0 of subdivision 2 of section 11-0905 of
the environmental conservation law to extend the open hunting season
of coyote from October 1 through May 31.

Section 2 This act shall take effect immediately.

EXISTING LAW:
Currently the coyote hunting season is October 1 through March 28.

JUSTIFICATION:
Concerns have been raised that the deer and other wildlife populations
in Essex County and other areas of the state suffers from severe
depredation during the winter months from coyotes attacking, chasing
or worrying deer and other wildlife.

The coyote population has ballooned and over-population exists which
further endangers and harasses landowner's pets and farm animals in
addition to the deer, rabbit, turkey, grouse and other small game
population.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.7249 2010
03/25/10 REFERRED TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
